bruch module¶

class bruch.Bruch(z, n=1)¶

Bases: object

Holds a fraction and allows special operations by using function/operator overloading

Variables:
  • z (int) – the numerator
  • n (int) – the denominator
__abs__()¶

returns a positive fraction when using Python’s abs() function, used in cases like: abs(Bruch(-3, 2)) -> Bruch(3, 2)

Returns:Bruch
__add__(other)¶
  • (add) operator overload, used in cases like:

Bruch(1, 2) + Bruch(3, 4) Bruch(2, 3) + 1

Parameters:other – Bruch, int, float
Returns:int, float
Raises:TypeError
__eq__(other)¶

== (equals) operator overload, checks if fractions are equal to each other, used in cases like: Bruch(2, 3) == Bruch(2, 3) -> True Bruch(1, 3) == Bruch(2, 6) -> True Bruch(1, 4) == Bruch(1, 2) -> False

Parameters:other – Bruch
Returns:boolean
Raises:TypeError
__float__()¶

returns the float value of a fraction, used in cases like: float(Bruch(1, 4)) -> 0.25

Returns:float
__iadd__(other)¶

+= (add) operator overload, used in cases like: bruch += 1 bruch += Bruch(2, 3)

Parameters:other – Bruch, int, float
Returns:Bruch
Raises:TypeError
__imul__(other)¶

+= (multiply) operator overload, used in cases like: bruch *= 2 bruch *= Bruch(3, 2)

Parameters:other – Bruch, int, float
Returns:Bruch
Raises:TypeError
__init__(z, n=1)¶

Initializes a fraction Bruch(2, 3) -> 2/3 Bruch(4) -> 4/1

Parameters:
  • z – the numerator
  • n – the denominator
Raises:

TypeError, ZeroDivisionError
__int__()¶

returns the int value of a fraction, used in cases like: int(6, 2) -> 3

Returns:int
__invert__()¶

inverts the numerator and denominator, used in cases like: ~Bruch(4, 2) -> Bruch(2, 4)

Returns:Bruch
__isub__(other)¶

-= (subtract) operator overload, used in cases like: bruch -= 1 bruch -= Bruch(2, 3)

Parameters:other – Bruch, int, float
Returns:Bruch
Raises:TypeError
__iter__()¶

returns the numerator and the denominator as a tuple

Returns:tuple?
__itruediv__(other)¶

/= (divide) operator overload

Parameters:other – Bruch, int, float
Returns:Bruch
Raises:TypeError, ZeroDivisionError
__mul__(other)¶
  • (multiply) operator overload, used in cases like:

Bruch(1, 2) * 2 Bruch(1, 4) * Bruch(2)

Parameters:other – Bruch, int, float
Returns:int, float
Raises:TypeError
__radd__(other)¶

right-hand + (add) operator overload, used in cases like: 1 + Bruch(1, 2)

Parameters:other – Bruch, int, float
Returns:int, float
Raises:TypeError
__rmul__(other)¶

right-hand * (multiply) operator overload, used in cases like: 2 * Bruch(1, 2) = 1

Parameters:other – Bruch, int, float
Returns:int, float
Raises:TypeError
__rsub__(other)¶

right-hand - (subtract) operator overload, used in cases like: 1 - Bruch(1, 2)

Parameters:other – Bruch, int, float
Returns:int, float
Raises:TypeError
__rtruediv__(other)¶

right-hand / (divide) operator overload, used in cases like: 4 / Bruch(2, 1)

Parameters:other – Bruch, int, float
Returns:int, float
Raises:TypeError, ZeroDivisionErrorer
__str__()¶

returns the fraction as a well formatted string, used in cases like: str(Bruch(2, 3)) -> “(2/3)” str(Bruch(3) -> “(3)”

Returns:str
__sub__(other)¶

” - (subtract) operator overload, used in cases like: Bruch(1, 2) - Bruch(3, 4) Bruch(2, 3) - 1

Parameters:other – Bruch, int, float
Returns:int, float
Raises:TypeError
__truediv__(other)¶

/ (divide) operator overload, used in cases like: Bruch(1, 2) / 2 Bruch(3, 2) / Bruch(3, 1)

Parameters:other – Bruch, int, float
Returns:int, float
Raises:TypeError, ZeroDivisionError
